page.title: 03GREAT WITLEY SCHOOL
page.content: There are 116 children at the school taught in five classes, two infant and three junior.The day begins at 8.55am. followed by assembly with the whole school at 9.10a.m. Mornings are spent doing mathematics and language work, with a 15 minute break at 10.40 a.m. During the afternoons the children study a range of subjects including history,geography,science,art,music, French-in the top class, P.E. and games. Throughout the week lessons are supplemented by television programmes, and computer work on the school's two computers. Various projects are investigated at the different levels. Religious education plays an important part in the ethos of the school. Parents are welcomed into the school to attend various functions, school productions, meetings with staff and end of term services.
